episodeTitle: The Noah Closing in! The Fish-Man Island Facing Destruction!
episodeTitleJapanese: ノア接近！魚人島壊滅の危機！
episodeTitleRomanized: Noa Sekkin! Gyojin-tō Kaimetsu no Kiki!
description: The giant ship Noah unexpectedly approaches Fish-Man Island, threatening to destroy the protective bubble. Luffy demonstrates his enhanced Haki abilities against Hody Jones while Shirahoshi makes a selfless decision to act as a decoy to save her home.

events.title: Noah Begins Its Descent Toward Fish-Man Island
events.description: The massive ancient ship Noah, half the size of Fish-Man Island itself, unexpectedly begins moving and descending toward the island, threatening to destroy it. King Neptune watches in shock, explaining that the ship must not be damaged at any cost.
events.significance: Introduces the immediate crisis of the arc and reveals the importance of Noah, a ship created during the Void Century that's connected to an ancient promise with Joy Boy.

quotes.text: That ship must not be damaged no matter what!
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Neptune's urgent warning about protecting Noah despite the danger it poses

quotes.text: That ship is not meant to move till the 'Promised Day' comes!
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Revealing the ancient significance of Noah

events.title: Luffy Uses Buso Koka: Gomu Gomu no Bullet
events.description: Luffy demonstrates his mastery of Armament Haki by hardening his fist and delivering a devastating Gomu Gomu no Bullet attack to Hody Jones, sending him crashing into a cliffside with enough force to shatter it.
events.significance: Showcases Luffy's enhanced combat abilities post-timeskip, demonstrating the full power of Armament Haki (Busoshoku Haki: Koka) in battle.

quotes.text: Buso Koka: Gomu Gomu no Bullet!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first named use of Armament Haki hardening with this technique

events.title: Luffy Uses Atama Buso: Gomu Gomu no Kane
events.description: Luffy employs another Armament Haki technique, hardening his head and using it as a weapon against Hody Jones in a headbutt attack, demonstrating his versatility with Haki.
events.significance: Further demonstrates Luffy's ability to apply Armament Haki to different parts of his body, showing his growth in combat versatility.

events.title: Vander Decken IX Betrays Hody Jones
events.description: Vander Decken IX reveals his true intentions, turning against his supposed ally Hody Jones and targeting Shirahoshi with deadly weapons after she rejected him. He declares his intention to kill her and everyone on Fish-Man Island.
events.significance: The breakdown of the villain alliance creates additional chaos and danger, showing Decken's obsessive and unhinged nature while raising the stakes for Shirahoshi.

quotes.text: If I cannot have you, Shirahoshi, then no one will! I'll destroy everything!
quotes.speaker: Vander Decken IX
quotes.context: Decken's declaration of his intent to kill Shirahoshi after her rejection

events.title: Shirahoshi Sacrifices Herself as a Decoy
events.description: Princess Shirahoshi makes the selfless decision to swim directly toward the massive Noah ship, using herself as a lure to divert its course away from Fish-Man Island and save her people, despite the mortal danger to herself.
events.significance: Demonstrates Shirahoshi's courage and growth as a character, showing her willingness to sacrifice herself for her kingdom. This decision also reveals her maturation from a frightened princess to someone willing to face danger.

quotes.text: I won't let everyone on Fish-Man Island die because of me!
quotes.speaker: Shirahoshi
quotes.context: Shirahoshi's declaration as she swims toward Noah to protect her people

events.title: Hody Jones Pursues Noah
events.description: Despite being battered by Luffy's attacks, Hody Jones grabs onto Noah's massive chains and begins pursuing the ship, seeking revenge on both Vander Decken IX for his betrayal and Luffy for defeating him.
events.significance: Sets up the continuation of the climactic battle aboard Noah, with multiple conflicts converging on the ancient ship.

events.title: Luffy Prepares to Follow Shirahoshi
events.description: Luffy decides to follow Shirahoshi to protect her from both the dangers of Noah and Vander Decken IX's attacks, setting up the final confrontation of the arc.
events.significance: Establishes Luffy's protective role and sets the stage for the arc's climax where he must save both Shirahoshi and Fish-Man Island from destruction.

events.title: Wadatsumi's Sacrifice Reveals Decken's Ruthlessness
events.description: When Wadatsumi calls for help as he falls, Vander Decken IX coldly tells him he cannot be saved and must be sacrificed, explaining that whatever he throws with his Mark-Mark Fruit power cannot be stopped until it reaches the target.
events.significance: Reveals the unstoppable nature of Decken's Devil Fruit ability and his complete lack of concern for his own allies, highlighting the desperate situation.

quotes.text: I cannot save you, Wadatsumi! You must be sacrificed for the cause!
quotes.speaker: Vander Decken IX
quotes.context: Decken abandoning Wadatsumi to his fate

quotes.text: That ship is not meant to move till the 'Promised Day' comes!
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Explaining the ancient significance of Noah

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Demonstrating Armament Haki against Hody Jones

quotes.context: Declaring his intent to destroy Fish-Man Island

quotes.speaker: Shirahoshi
quotes.context: Deciding to sacrifice herself as a decoy

themes.description: Shirahoshi's decision to use herself as a decoy demonstrates tremendous courage and personal growth, showing her willingness to sacrifice herself for her people.
themes.symbolism: Shirahoshi swimming toward Noah represents her stepping out of her fearful shell and embracing her role as princess.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the weight of ancient history through Noah's significance, connecting the present crisis to promises made during the Void Century.
themes.symbolism: Noah represents the unfulfilled promise between Joy Boy and the ancient Poseidon, creating a parallel between past and present.

themes.description: Luffy's demonstration of Armament Haki showcases his growth during the timeskip and his readiness to face New World challenges.
themes.symbolism: The black hardening of Haki symbolizes Luffy's maturity and strength.

characterSpotlights.development: Shirahoshi overcomes her fear and makes a selfless decision to protect Fish-Man Island, showing significant character growth from the frightened princess introduced earlier in the arc.

mangaDifferences.difference: In the manga, Luffy's Armament Haki-imbued punch to Hody was unnamed. In the anime, it was specifically named as 'Buso Koka: Gomu Gomu no Bullet'.

trivia.fact: This episode corresponds to manga chapters 636 (page 19) and 637 (pages 2-19).
Noah is stated to be approximately half the size of Fish-Man Island itself, making it one of the largest ships in the One Piece world.
The biblical reference to Noah's Ark is intentional, as the ship in One Piece is also meant for a mass migration or salvation purpose.
